intro: Secamone canescens, commonly known as the desert secamone, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Secamone canescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
